frame.name: Hostile_encounter
frame.definition: <def-root>This frame consists of words that describe a hostile encounter between opposing forces (<fen>Side_1</fen> and <fen>Side_2</fen>, collectively conceptualizable as <fen>Sides</fen>) over a disputed <fen>Issue</fen> and/or in order to reach a specific <fen>Purpose</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Side_1
FE.definition: <def-root>One of two participants in a hostile encounter. While <fex name="Side_1">the U.S.'s</fex> <t>battle</t> with terrorist-harboring nations is far off ...</def-root>

FE.name: Side_2
FE.definition: <def-root>One of two participants in a hostile encounter, usually the second mentioned. <ex>While the U.S.'s <t>battle</t> <fex name="Side_2">with terrorist-harboring nations</fex> is far off ...</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Sides
FE.definition: <def-root>The jointly expressed sides in a hostile encounter. <fex name="Sides">They</fex> <t>fought</t> over the right to own land.</def-root>

FE.name: Issue
FE.definition:
<def-root>An unresolved question over which the two sides of a hostile encounter are in disagreement.
<ex>They had a <t>dust-up</t> <fex name="Issue">over who was prettier</fex> .</ex>
Quite often it takes the form of a covert question of various sorts. So in an example like:
<ex>They <t>fought</t> <fex name="Issue">over the right to own land</fex>.</ex>
among many other possibilities, the covert question might be more explicitly phrased as follows:
<ex>They <t>fought</t> <fex name="Issue">over what the right to own land means</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>The desired result of the outcome of the hostile encounter for the <fen>Side_1</fen> or for all the <fen>Sides</fen> collectively. It may either directly refer to the state of affairs that is desired, e.g.
<ex>He <t>dueled</t> with his former second <fex name="Purpose">to defend the honour of the man he had killed</fex> .</ex>
or it the state of affairs may be implicit in an (abstract or concrete) entity that they desire, e.g.
<ex>Rival Democratic presidential candidates Mr Bill Clinton and Mr Jerry Brown taunted each other at the weekend as mudslinging in the <t>battle</t> <fex name="Purpose">for votes</fex> in tomorrow's crucial New York primary reached a new low.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>Means describes the way in which a side engages in a hostile encounter. President Corazon Aquino of the Philippines is bracing herself for a <fex name="Means">legal</fex> <t>battle</t> over her decision to allow the remains of the former president, Ferdinand Marcos, to be returned home from Hawaii for burial.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any expression which describes a property of the hostile encounter. Descriptions of the intensity count as Manner expressions. After Brundle's Jaguar took off like a scalded cat, it was Mass who hunted it down, an soon engaged it in a <fex name="Manner">lurid</fex> <t>battle</t>.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location at which the hostile encounter takes place.
<ex>Following the <t>battle</t> <fex name="Place">of Naseby</fex> in 1645 ...</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time at which the hostile encounter occurs.
<ex>Following the <t>battle</t> of Naseby <fex name="Time">in 1645</fex> he died.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>Depictive phrase describing the actor of an action</def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>The amount of time for which a state holds or a process is ongoing.</def-root>

FE.name: Reason
FE.definition: <def-root>The Reason for which an event occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Instrument
FE.definition: <def-root>The instrument with which an intentional act is performed.</def-root>

FE.name: Internal_cause
FE.definition: <def-root>The body movement may be prompted by either some outside phenomenon or occurrence, or by an Internal Cause, the Agent's mental or emotional state. Internal Cause is expressed in a PP Complement: Kim <t>frowned</t> <fex name="Internal_cause">in concentration</fex>. Kim <t>threw</t> her hands up <fex name="Internal_cause">in despair</fex>. </def-root>

FE.name: Particular_iteration
FE.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: battle.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a lengthy and difficult conflict or struggle

lexUnit.name: fight.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an act of fighting

lexUnit.name: scuffle.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a short, confused fight or struggle at close quarters

lexUnit.name: spat.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a petty quarrel

lexUnit.name: altercation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an angry dispute

lexUnit.name: duel.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: (chiefly historical) a pre-arranged contest with deadly weapons between two people to settle a point of honour

lexUnit.name: clash.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: have a forceful disagreement

lexUnit.name: confrontation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an open conflict of opposing groups, parties, or individuals

lexUnit.name: row.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an acrimonious quarrel

lexUnit.name: fighting.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a struggle for victory or mastery between two or more people, animals, or forces.

lexUnit.name: bout.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a contest between antagonists

lexUnit.name: struggle.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an act of struggling

lexUnit.name: hostility.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being at war

lexUnit.name: skirmish.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an episode of irrgular or unpremeditated fighting, especially between small or outlying parts of armies

lexUnit.name: combat.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: fighting, especially between armed forces

lexUnit.name: squabble.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a trivial noisy quarrel

lexUnit.name: stalemate.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a situation in which further progress by opposing parties seems impossible

lexUnit.name: brawl.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a rough or noisy fight or quarrel

lexUnit.name: strife.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: angry or bitter disagreement; conflict

lexUnit.name: fight.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: take part in a violent struggle involving physical force or weapons.

lexUnit.name: battle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fight or struggle tenaciously with an enemy or to achieve something.

lexUnit.name: duel.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fight a duel

lexUnit.name: clash.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of two opposing groups) come abruptly into violent conflict.

lexUnit.name: brawl.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: take part in a brawl

lexUnit.name: skirmish.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: engage in a minor conflict or fight

lexUnit.name: scuffle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: engage in a scuffle

lexUnit.name: confront.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: stand or meet face to face with hostile intent.

lexUnit.name: war.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a state of competition, conflict, or hostility

lexUnit.name: war.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: engage in a war

lexUnit.name: gunfight.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a fight involving an exchange of fire with guns.

lexUnit.name: shootout.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: informal a decisive gun battle.

lexUnit.name: standoff.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a deadlock between two equally matched opponents.

lexUnit.name: showdown.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a final test or confrontation intended to settle a dispute.

lexUnit.name: wrangling.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: long and complicated arguing

lexUnit.name: tiff.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: informal a quarrel.

lexUnit.name: fistfight.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a fight with the fists

lexUnit.name: firefight.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a battle using guns rather than bombs or other weapons.

lexUnit.name: conflict.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a prolonged armed struggle

lexUnit.name: dust-up.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a fight or quarrel.

lexUnit.name: warfare.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: violent military operations between combatants

lexUnit.name: cw.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: chemical warfare

lexUnit.name: bw.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: biological warfare

lexUnit.name: tussle.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a vigorous struggle or scuffle.

lexUnit.name: struggle.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to fight against an enemy or some kind of feature, esp. when the odds of victory are slim

lexUnit.name: infighting.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: fighting at close quarters
